The phoenix-like leader of the tripredacus was mad. They have gotten 
pounded in the face of an enemy he had sought to intimidate because of 
the arrival of reinforcements, too much reinforcements. The journey on 
Earth would be a long one. Also, he held in his talon the last remain 
of one of his warriors, a single limp techno-organic tentacle.

Tyrael flew down to the transformed ship that was their base. He 
opened a general Tripredacus channel.

Tyrael: Every unit, gather on my signal.

He remarked the slithering form of Naga. His friend looked... 
suspicious...

Naga: How was the battle, Major?

Tyrael: We were beaten, but they shall taste defeat another day. What 
news have you for me, Naga?

The snake frowned slightly.

Naga: A lone bot came. I tried to convince him to join us, but he 
refused, saying he preferred to stay unbound to duty.

Tyrael's fury started to bleed in his tone.

Tyrael: Just how much did you tell him?

Naga: Well... huh... A lot, sir.

Tyrael: Too much, you treacherous viper! You do know that we have to 
kill anyone knowing about us! Find a pod and get in stasis lock!

Naga was both relieved and shocked at the punishment. He would not 
perish, but nor would he see any more combat until they get back to 
their headquarters. He simply executed his order, silently.

Tyrael: Every other unit! Gather up now!
